snippet: An unlicensed medical practitioner was given a 25-year prison term for infecting more than 100 villagers by reusing unsanitized syringes.
abstract: Cambodian court sentences Yem Chrin to 25 years in prison for infecting over 100 villagers with HIV and causing at least 10 deaths; unlicensed medical practitioner had spread AIDS virus by reusing unsterilized syringes.
lead_paragraph: An unlicensed medical practitioner was given a 25-year prison term for infecting more than 100 villagers by reusing unsanitized syringes.

headline.main: Cambodia: Medic Sentenced for Spreading H.I.V.
headline.print_headline: Asia; Cambodia: Medic Sentenced for Spreading H.I.V.
